intro: Carlina acanthophylla, commonly known as the roughleaf cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Carlina acanthophylla is also noted for its medicinal properties, historically used by Native American tribes.
